msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 50
ab.l: And Joseph fell on his father’s face,and wept over him, and kissed him.
AndJoseph commanded his servants, the physicians, to embalmhis father. And the physicians embalmed Israel.
And forty days were filled for him, because this is howthe days of those who are embalmed are filled. And the Egyptians wept for himseventy days.
And the days of his weeping passed,and Joseph spoke to the house of Pharaoh, saying,‘If now I have found favour in your eyes, speaknow in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,

“My fathermade me swear, saying, “Lo, I will die. In my grave,which I have dug for me in the land of Canaan: you shall bury me there.”And now, let me go now, and let me bury my father,and I will come back.”’
And Pharaoh said, ‘Go andbury your father as he had you swear.’
And Joseph went to bury his father, andall the servants of Pharaoh went with him, the elders of his house, and all the eldersof the land of Egypt,
And all the people of Joseph’s house, and his brothers,and the people of his father’s house. Only their little ones and their flocks and theircattle they left in the land of Goshen.
Andboth chariots and horsemen went with him. And it was a very great camp.

And they came to the threshing-floor ofthe place which is called Atad, which is at the ford of Jordan, andthere they cried with a great and very strong cry. Andhe made a mourning for his father for seven days.

Andthe inhabitants of the land of Canaan saw the mourning inthe place which is called Goren the Atad, and they said, ‘This is a strongmourning to the Egyptians.’ Therefore the name of it was called Abel-Mizraim,which is at the ford of Jordan.
And his sons didto him as he had commanded them.

Andhis sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buriedhim in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham boughtwith the field for a possession of a sepulchre from Ephron the Hittite,before Mamre.
And Joseph returned to Egypt,he, and his brothers, and all that went with himto bury his father, after he had buried his father.
And Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead,and they said, ‘Joseph will perhaps be hostile to us,and will certainly pay back to us all the evil which we payedto him.’
And they sent a message to Joseph, saying,‘Your father had command before he died:

“So shall you sayto Joseph, “Forgive now, we pray you, the trespass of your brothersand their sin, because they payed you evil.”” Andnow, forgive the trespass of the servants of the God of your father.’And Joseph wept when they spoke to him.
Andhis brothers also went and fell down before him,and they said, ‘Lo, we are your servants.’
AndJoseph said to them, ‘Do not fear, because am I in the place of God?
And you thought bad against me.God thought for good: to make it as it is this day, to savemany people alive.
And now, do not fear: Iwill nourish you and your little ones.’ And he comforted them, and spoketo their hearts.
And Joseph dwelt in Egypt,he and the people of his father’s house. And Joseph lived a hundredand ten years.
And Joseph saw Ephraim’s childrenof the third generation. Also the children of Machir, son of Manasseh,were brought up on Joseph’s knees.
And Joseph said to his brothers, ‘I will die. And Godwill surely remember you and bring you out of this landto the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.’
And Joseph made the sons of Israel swear,saying, ‘God will surely remember you, and you shall takemy bones from here.’

And Joseph died,a hundred and ten |years| old. And they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffinin Egypt.With the help of Him who declares the end from the beginningthe peshatim of the Book of Genesis are finished.And now I start to write the peshatim of the Book of Exoduswith the help of Him who is praised by all the souls.

app.note: K: Goren ol Atad, a partial translation of Heb. אֶת־הָאֵבֶל בְּגֹרֶן הָֽאָטָד ‘on the threshing-floor of Atad’.
